Summed up as Assassin's Creed meets The Sims, The Ship is a very original game that has the ability to make you paranoid as you walk down the corridors, wondering if that person about to pass you in the hall is your hunter, ready to stab you in the chest.

After a while he wanted to leave, but there was a random guy blocking his exit.  So I looked over the shoulder of the random guy and shot my friend in the face with the Blunderbuss.  I shot him straight back onto the toilet, and the random guy walked in and p*ssed on his corpse.    10/10.

This game is a fantastic group experience for anyone wanting to spend an evening stabbing your friends in the back. The Offline part is garbage, and playing the online multiplayer is decent fun, but the game truly shines when you have a large group of friends (4+) on a private server taunting eachother over voice chat and screaming in panic when you pull the shotgun. If you're flying solo, then keep on browsing, but if you've got friends to VC with, this game earns a flawless 10/10.  The only downside is that, rather than fix the server issues (There are no dedicated servers, you have to find publicly run servers to play on or make one yourself.) They instead released a worse version of the game under the pretense of it being a 'remastering.' The new version straight up removes some of the game elements and changes others, while adding little, if any to compensate.  Worst of all, in my opinion, is that with the release of a re-mastering, they've removed the ability to buy a 5 pack of the Ship for 20 dollars. 5 friends tossing 4$ in the hat was the single greatest purchase I've ever made on steam, but asking each person to pony up 10$, especially when the game's most fun with friends? They properly shot themselves in the foot with that.  TL;DR This old version is better than the remastered one, and the game is best experienced with friends, voice chat, and perhaps just a little alcohol.

Personal Rating: 7/10  This game is fun, however what would be more fun is if people actually played the game still. I mean, trading cards were added which is great for me as I like to craft the badges, but how many players did that honestly SHIP in. There are a variety of weapons, outfits and items to choose from that can kill and maim your shipmates, from Frying Pan to Flare Gun, you can pretty much use anything to your advantage.  If you have a few friends that would like to play this game, then you can get it pretty cheap in the sales now-a-days and set up your own server. I did it a while back and we had hours of fun. Of course, to stick a twist on the endless murders, you need to keep yourself alive and cater to your basic needs such as sleeping, showering, eating and talking to people. The simplest of tasks become so tense as anyone can just sneak up on you while you shower and blow your face off with a shotgun.  So, should you buy this game? If you can get it on the sale, sure, but if you're buying it for full price then be prepared to be dissapointed at the lack of players. You could always play the single-player though which is fun...

As a passenger, you can aid in security by performing a citizen's arrest on those you find to be suspicious. All in all, this is a fantastic game of wit and skill, similar to source mod, trouble in terrorist town.

The gameplay alone is amazing. The entire concept of having to be on board a ship full of murderers including yourself makes this rich, as well as having it very well balanced. the fact that it adds many variables that you need to keep in check on top of killing adds difficulty and immersion to the game, and there's many opportunities for you to kill people as well as get killed. It's splendid and I'd recommend it if you can play LAN with a couple friends.   My only gripe is the fact that there are no more dedicated servers to host multiplayer matches. I hate this because playing with real people makes it more intense as you need to think who may be a real person or an AI, and it's a lot more fun to kill someone knowing they'll have a reaction. On top of that; the games AI isn't very smart either. They'll hardly ever attack you, or sometimes it's easy to know that they're hunting you. Still it's a great game and with how cheap it is with sales it's worth it for the experience.

They broke all 7 of my steel doors with their bare fists, escaping into the yard. They were almost out. I managed to keep the tsunami of prisoners back, put the prison on lockdown and finally the armed police got here.  I did it, I stopped the riot.  But then I saw that one particular cell was empty. I have been playing Tiger Woods '08 PC on a regular basis since it came out back in 2007. No modern game has come close. That is until this game was released.   The graphics are top notch and very realistic. The addition of trees and bushes since last year improved the visuals a great deal. The graphic improvements will no doubt continue in the future with the possible addition of 3D blades of grass using Nvidia’s graphics technology.  Online play is great with turn based multiplayer and the ability to play with up to 8 players. You can stop and resume your round at a later time. There are loads of different play modes available. If tournaments are your thing you can participate in many online. The game also has a cool replay feature that allows you to watch the last round from a number of different angles. Your opponent(s) can see the replays as well.  Another big plus for the game is the freecam mode. Take a virtual tour of the entire game from every conceivable angle and soak in the wonderful immersion that this game provides.  This game has lived up to its potential. Every update over the last year has shown improvement, especially the most recent update from last month. This community driven game will only get better in the months and years to come. Be sure to give it a try and you won't be disappointed.

The Ship is a relatively entertaining game, but is plagued by many flaws.  It came out a while ago - 2006, in fact, and it does show its age, unfortunately. It's 'old-school', but not in a nice way. It all feels just a little bit clunky and laboured while playing it, and that just wouldn't be tolerated if it came out today.  Onto the game itself. I'll address the singleplayer first and foremost - it's pretty short and only lasts about an hour or two. It is intended to prepare you for the multiplayer, the main part of the game, but it's rather ineffective in doing so. You're never placed into a situation you would actually face in the multiplayer - mostly it's a case of go here, talk to this person, kill this guy, rinse and repeat (leaving out the occassional other trivial act). It doesn't help that the singleplayer is very frustrating at points and feels lazily done. To be honest, there's no real point in playing it.  Now, the multiplayer. If you're reading this, I assume you understand the whole concept of the game. The concept does seem extremely entertaining. However, it's not executed as well as you would like. The maps are all too small for 24-32 players like the very few servers remaining are and you often find yourself cramped in rooms, getting blocked in corridors etc. The inclusion of security is poorly done - guards, cameras and witnesses seem to be just about everywhere meaning you rarely ever find a good opportunity to take out your quarry. You look to take out your target, only to realise there's a camera watching and you're arrested for pulling out your weapon. The needs system becomes tedious quickly - I can't be bothered going to the toilet or sleeping when I'm avoiding my hunter and searching for my quarry. You also only have 90 seconds for each round to kill your quarry, which is nowhere nearly enough time. The jail system is another major flaw in the game also - if you kill your quarry, you can deliberately get yourself arrested so as to be protected from the person hunting you. This can then also be undermined by your hunter deliberately putting themselves into jail and seeing if they can get the shank to take you out. There are plenty of other examples of things like this that just make you think 'That could have been done so much better'.  It doesn't help that quite a number of people who play the game run around like headless chickens killing on sight as they are suspicious of anyone around them. Your enjoyment of this game is almost entirely based around other people and how they act - and when they act like they often do, it ruins it.  And I still haven't mentioned the obvious yet - the game is pretty much dead. Servers are mainly filled with bots rather than players. The developers, Outerlight, don't even exist anymore so hopes of changes are nonexistent. However, there's a sequel on Greenlight that looks like it could be very good.   Perhaps I'm not giving the game enough credit - it is relatively fun...for 15 to 20 minute periods. Then the same old flaws appear again and again and you just want to go and play something else. It's a real shame, because if this game had been much, much more polished and it had an active community these days I would have tons of fun with it. I got it for 70p on Bundlestars, and I don't really mind at that price. Let's hope for more in the sequel.

Enjoyable... with a disclaimer.  This game is very enjoyable, with a great art style and a fun concept: a bunch of people on a cruise-ship together must get weapons and battle each other to the death for a huge cash-prize. Sadly this game is not all roses and tommy-guns. One of the biggest flaws with this game is the 'mood' system, which feels like it was copy-pasted from 'The Sims', and shoehorned horribly into this game. The problem with it is that you must constantly maintain numerous personal issues like hunger, thirst, bladder, tiredness, etc... or else you will fall over dead. The big problem with this though is that it's so easy to cause these issues to spike, like how killing people makes you nervous and you need to talk to people to feel better, which is smart... but if you're in the middle of a cluster♥♥♥♥ of gunfire, and you kill too many people, your anxiety will skyrocket, you'll be frozen in place while your character has themselves a little crying break, leaving you open to any and all attacks for at least ten seconds. Overall the game is enjoyable, but it certainly has problems, and I mean MAJOR problems. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone on the basis that it takes a specific kind of person to enjoy it, so be sure you don't waste money on this game and instead find a friend who has it, and play their copy for a while.

Regardless of gameplay, there's just something about games with broken multiplayer server lists that leave a bitter taste in my mouth. For a €20 product, I shouldn't have to rely on external server lists. Or in fact, any other tool which enables gameplay.

Sad to say, but this game is dead. Nonetheless, it's not going to stop me from praising it in hopes that some of you will buy it and we can do some in-house games.  The Ship is primarily a multiplayer game with the single player portion serving only as a tutorial. The plot might as well be absent, but for those who are curious, you are a passenger on a luxurious cruise ship tasked with killing other shipmates for your survival. Every round, you are assigned a target and you must hunt them. While you go about your business, someone has you as their target. For those who are familiar with the multiplayer component of Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood, that gameplay is derived from The Ship. Scoring is based on the amount of money you make per kill which is determined by the weapons you use. The more common a weapon is used, the less value a kill from it will yield.  All in all, it's definitely a unique take on the FPS genre and it certainly deserves another chance.  Grade: B+

I got this game about three days ago, but due to issues both on Blazing Griffin's end and Valve's end, I have been unable to connect to any servers to play this game. Blazing Griffin apparantly only has publishing rights to the game, and unless Valve updates it (which won't be likely), we all have to go without playing the ship as a multiplayer game, which is how it was intended to be. In my honest opinion, this game has sacrificed its integrity in that manner. I would recommend it, because I'm sure that it would be insanely fun, but I can't because I've never even been able to begin to play it. So therefore, I cannot recommend this game. As far as I am concerned, however, this issue has been going on for over two years, and the fact that I had to do such extensive research to figure out that the game cannot be easily played is ludacris. I do not recommend this game for those reasons. The only game that is under The Ship's name that you CAN play is the single player version, which is very good, but short (only about ten missions to accomplish; it can easily be completed in under a day). It is a shame, it really is, that a game that is beginning to get a surge of popularity from YouTube is unable to be played by people who want to play the game without monetary gain.

Source mod gone full retail. The Ship is a great premise: Find your target among the people on a cruise ship and take them out, while someone else is doing the same to hunt you down. Throw in a Sims style needs system so players can't camp, a weapon bounty system so players need to try out new weapons, and a lovely 1920's style atmosphere, and you *should* have a great game.   However, The Ship does show many problems, mostly when compared to it's mod predecessor. In the mod, there would be many civilians to confuse and work around to get to your target. In The Ship, you rarely see more than one or two civilians in total on these large cruise ships. Because of this, many games just turn into a deathmatch rather than a complex game of stalking and decieving. You can turn up the amount of civvies, but there's still a very small limit on that, and rarely multiplayer servers turn this config on.  The Ship is also very dated. The game hasn't been updated in many years, and the controls show it. Even once you get past that, there's still some very strange workarounds you can find on the levels. It just feels old, rather than classic or 'old school'. What's worse, the previous devs have been absorbed into Ubisoft, and the current publisher for The Ship, Blazing Griffin, can't secure the rights to modifiy the game's code (even after a failed Kickstarter campaign), so it's stuck like this for the forseeable future.  If you can gather together a group of friends who all understand the little things and problems with The Ship, you can enjoy it for a while, but it won't last forever. Grab it if it's on sale.

This game is very(and I mean very ) worth it.  The single player is nice when you want to enjoy a simple plot line. The game explains very well what you need to do and how you need to do it. In the beginning of the game you will probably feel invincible because it seems that no one is hunting you. You don't need to watch your back and you can actually enjoy doing some activities. As the game progresses, the npcs start hunting you. Now eating, peeing, and bathing starts to get a bit difficult and you become paranoid. Luckily, the single player campaign(or mode) is a short game, therefore, there is no need to worry. The multiplayer is very fun. In the multiplayer you can't be as relaxed as in the singleplayer. You got to get the supplies you need quickly or it may be to late, depending on who you are player with.  So in the end, I think you should just get the game.

The game is very simple and entertaining.  More fun when playing multiplayer with others also fun when playing alone.  I get the problem of many that you cannot access servers from the main game. All in all the game is fun, everybody gets a query to kill one another and you can find weapons all around the ship from cupbaords, drawers, on the wall etc.. You are not allowed to kill your query in front of guards or staff personnel and you should try to remain non suspicious the whole time or else others can kill you. At the same time you have things to keep updating yourself through out the game such as your food intake, bladder, sleep, shower, reading a book etc...  Maybe the bad part I would say or not very bad but it kinda finishes the game quickly is one thing. You can know where your query is, it will say on the right hand side where your query was the last time which makes the game finish quickly.  All in all ITS FUN, it is a calmer version of Gary's Mod murder where everybody is a killer to another.   I totally recommend it specially it is very cheap.
